The official unemployment rate: which was 4 percent in January, dropped as low as 3.7 percent in September and November — marking the first time it had been that low since 1969.
The U: 6 rate, an alternative measure of labor underutilization, was 8.1 percent in January, which includes the total unemployed, discouraged workers, and part-time workers who cannot find full-time work for economic reasons.
Under Trump: the U-6 rate had dropped to its lowest level in 17 years, reaching 7.4 percent in August 2018.
The current U: 6 rate of 8.1 percent is 1.2 percentage points lower than when Trump took office and much lower than the monthly average of 10.4 percent since 1994, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
